definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.chinese: 我找不到任何类似“奥曼”的地名。

sentences.english: It was impossible for her to see the word without thinking of Pemberley and its owner.
sentences.chinese: 她看到这个地名，就不禁想到彭伯里和彭伯里的主人。

sentences.english: The academic field which has developed to study placenames is called toponymy.
sentences.chinese: 而地名学就是以语言为基本线索，研究地名的科学。

sentences.english: The academic field which has developed to study placenames is called toponymy.
sentences.chinese: 而地名学就是以语言为基本线索，研究地名的科学。

sentences.english: The evidence of the place-names in this region lends support to the statement.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区的地名证据正好支持这种说法。

sentences.english: Tibetan, Zhongdian County, with city names "Reunion were" consistent.
sentences.chinese: 它与中甸县古城藏语地名“尼旺宗”相一致。

sentences.english: The Tang state in southern Shanxi was first built in the late Shang dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 晋南的唐国始于晚商时期，此前本地无“唐”的地名。

sentences.english: Both the general names and the proper names are the important parts of the Zhuang geograpnical names system.
sentences.chinese: 通名和专名是壮语地名词汇系统的重要内容。

sentences.english: The use of apostrophes in British place names is a subject of querulous debate.
sentences.chinese: 撇号在英国地名中的使用也是充斥抱怨的争论话题。

sentences.english: Sanxing, the ancient place name, is Yilan County of Heilongjiang Province today.
sentences.chinese: 三姓，古地名，今黑龙江省依兰县。

sentences.english: Place-names refers to some features or geographical names.
sentences.chinese: 地名是指一些地物或地域的名称。

sentences.english: Did you hear such place-name in city?
sentences.chinese: 城里能听见这样的地名吗？

sentences.english: The second chapter mainly deals with the structural characteristics of the Geographical Names in Sonid Left Banner.
sentences.chinese: 第二章，主要阐述了苏尼特左旗地名的结构特征。

sentences.english: This article discussed the historical relations between toponymy and ancient nationality in HeiLongJiang Province.
sentences.chinese: 本文论述了黑龙江省地名学与古代民族的历史关系。

sentences.english: All persons and places mentioned are carefully indexed.
sentences.chinese: 所有被提及的人名和地名都仔细编入索引中。

sentences.english: I find some of the place-names barely pronounceable.
sentences.chinese: 我发现有些地名简直没法念。

definition: pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
classical story or quote from the literature/the story behind sth
old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
Chinese character/CL:個|个[ge4]/Japanese: kanji/Korean: hanja/Vietnamese: hán tự
the first Chinese dialect dictionary, edited by Yang Xiong 揚雄|扬雄[Yang2 Xiong2] in 1st century, containing over 9000 characters
